text: Better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Tennyson

text: Where there is marriage without love, there will be love without marriage.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: That is the nature of women, not to love when we love them, and to love when we love them not.
author: Miguel Cervantes

text: Nobody loves a woman because she is handsome or ugly, stupid or intelligent. We love because we love.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love.
author: Jean de Labruyer

text: When you are not in love, you are not alive.
author: Elvis Presley

text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship never.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
author: Joan Crawford

text: We hate the ones we love because they can cause the deepest suffering.
author: Joan Crawford

text: If you wish to be loved, love!
author: Seneca

text: While I am breathing, I love and believe.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: True love stories never have endings.
author: Richard Bach
